speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: Beseech you, sir, were you present at this

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: relation?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: I was by at the opening of the fardel,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: heard the old shepherd deliver the manner how he

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: found it, whereupon, after a little amazedness, we

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: were all commanded out of the chamber. Only this,

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: methought, I heard the shepherd say: he found the

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: child.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: I would most gladly know the issue of it.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: I make a broken delivery of the

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: business, but the changes I perceived in the King

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: and Camillo were very notes of admiration. They

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: seemed almost, with staring on one another, to tear

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: the cases of their eyes. There was speech in their

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: dumbness, language in their very gesture. They

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: looked as they had heard of a world ransomed, or

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: one destroyed. A notable passion of wonder appeared

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: in them, but the wisest beholder that knew

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: no more but seeing could not say if th’ importance

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: were joy or sorrow; but in the extremity of the one it

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: must needs be.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Here comes a gentleman that happily knows more.—

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: The news, Rogero?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Nothing but bonfires. The oracle

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: is fulfilled: the King’s daughter is found! Such a

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: deal of wonder is broken out within this hour that

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: ballad makers cannot be able to express it.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Here comes the Lady Paulina’s steward. He can

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: deliver you more.—How goes it now, sir? This news

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: which is called true is so like an old tale that the

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: verity of it is in strong suspicion. Has the King

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: found his heir?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Most true, if ever truth were pregnant

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: by circumstance. That which you hear you’ll

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: swear you see, there is such unity in the proofs. The

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: mantle of Queen Hermione’s, her jewel about the

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: neck of it, the letters of Antigonus found with it,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: which they know to be his character, the majesty of

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: the creature in resemblance of the mother, the

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: affection of nobleness which nature shows above

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: her breeding, and many other evidences proclaim

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: her with all certainty to be the King’s daughter. Did

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: you see the meeting of the two kings?

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: No.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Then have you lost a sight which

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: was to be seen, cannot be spoken of. There might

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: you have beheld one joy crown another, so and in

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: such manner that it seemed sorrow wept to take

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: leave of them, for their joy waded in tears. There

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: was casting up of eyes, holding up of hands, with

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: countenance of such distraction that they were to

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: be known by garment, not by favor. Our king, being

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: ready to leap out of himself for joy of his found

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: daughter, as if that joy were now become a loss,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: cries “O, thy mother, thy mother!” then asks Bohemia

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: forgiveness, then embraces his son-in-law, then

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: again worries he his daughter with clipping her.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Now he thanks the old shepherd, which stands by

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: like a weather-bitten conduit of many kings’ reigns.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: I never heard of such another encounter, which

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: lames report to follow it and undoes description to

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: do it.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: What, pray you, became of Antigonus,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: that carried hence the child?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Like an old tale still, which will

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: have matter to rehearse though credit be asleep and

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: not an ear open: he was torn to pieces with a bear.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: This avouches the shepherd’s son, who has not only

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: his innocence, which seems much, to justify him,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: but a handkerchief and rings of his that Paulina

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: knows.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: What became of his bark and his

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: followers?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Wracked the same instant of their

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: master’s death and in the view of the shepherd, so

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: that all the instruments which aided to expose the

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: child were even then lost when it was found. But O,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: the noble combat that ’twixt joy and sorrow was

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: fought in Paulina. She had one eye declined for the

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: loss of her husband, another elevated that the

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: oracle was fulfilled. She lifted the Princess from the

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: earth, and so locks her in embracing as if she would

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: pin her to her heart that she might no more be in

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: danger of losing.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: The dignity of this act was worth the

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: audience of kings and princes, for by such was it

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: acted.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: One of the prettiest touches of all,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: and that which angled for mine eyes—caught the

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: water, though not the fish—was when at the relation

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: of the Queen’s death—with the manner how

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: she came to ’t bravely confessed and lamented by

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: the King—how attentiveness wounded his daughter,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: till, from one sign of dolor to another, she did,

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: with an “Alas,” I would fain say bleed tears, for I am

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: sure my heart wept blood. Who was most marble

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: there changed color; some swooned, all sorrowed.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: If all the world could have seen ’t, the woe had been

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: universal.

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Are they returned to the court?

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: No. The Princess hearing of her

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: mother’s statue, which is in the keeping of

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Paulina—a piece many years in doing and now

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: newly performed by that rare Italian master, Julio

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Romano, who, had he himself eternity and could

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: put breath into his work, would beguile Nature of

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: her custom, so perfectly he is her ape; he so near to

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Hermione hath done Hermione that they say one

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: would speak to her and stand in hope of answer.

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Thither with all greediness of affection are they

speaker:
THIRD
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: gone, and there they intend to sup.

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: I thought she had some great

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: matter there in hand, for she hath privately twice or

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: thrice a day, ever since the death of Hermione,

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: visited that removed house. Shall we thither and

speaker:
SECOND
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: with our company piece the rejoicing?

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: Who would be thence that has the

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: benefit of access? Every wink of an eye some new

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: grace will be born. Our absence makes us unthrifty

speaker:
FIRST
               
              GENTLEMAN
text: to our knowledge. Let’s along.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: Now, had I not the dash of my former life

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: in me, would preferment drop on my head. I

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: brought the old man and his son aboard the Prince,

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: told him I heard them talk of a fardel and I know

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: not what. But he at that time, overfond of the

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: shepherd’s daughter—so he then took her to be—

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: who began to be much seasick, and himself little

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: better, extremity of weather continuing, this mystery

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: remained undiscovered. But ’tis all one to

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: me, for had I been the finder-out of this secret, it

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: would not have relished among my other

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: discredits.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: Here come those I have done good to against my

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: will, and already appearing in the blossoms of their

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: fortune.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Come, boy, I am past more children, but thy

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: sons and daughters will be all gentlemen born.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: You are well met, sir.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: You denied to fight with me this other day because I

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: was no gentleman born. See you these clothes? Say

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: you see them not and think me still no gentleman

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: born. You were best say these robes are not gentlemen

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: born. Give me the lie, do, and try whether I am

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: not now a gentleman born.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: I know you are now, sir, a gentleman born.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Ay, and have been so any time these

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: four hours.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: And so have I, boy.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: So you have—but I was a gentleman

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: born before my father. For the King’s son took me

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: by the hand and called me brother, and then the

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: two kings called my father brother, and then the

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Prince my brother and the Princess my sister called

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: my father father; and so we wept, and there was the

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: first gentlemanlike tears that ever we shed.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: We may live, son, to shed many more.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Ay, or else ’twere hard luck, being in

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: so preposterous estate as we are.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: I humbly beseech you, sir, to pardon me all

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: the faults I have committed to your Worship and to

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: give me your good report to the Prince my master.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: Prithee, son, do, for we must be gentle now

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: we are gentlemen.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Thou wilt amend thy

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: life?

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: Ay, an it like your good Worship.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Give me thy hand. I will swear to the

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Prince thou art as honest a true fellow as any is in

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Bohemia.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: You may say it, but not swear it.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Not swear it, now I am a gentleman?

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Let boors and franklins say it; I’ll swear it.

speaker: SHEPHERD
text: How if it be false, son?

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: If it be ne’er so false, a true gentleman

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: may swear it in the behalf of his friend.—And

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: I’ll swear to the Prince thou art a tall fellow of thy

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: hands and that thou wilt not be drunk; but I know

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: thou art no tall fellow of thy hands and that thou

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: wilt be drunk. But I’ll swear it, and I would thou

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: wouldst be a tall fellow of thy hands.

speaker: AUTOLYCUS
text: I will prove so, sir, to my power.

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: Ay, by any means prove a tall fellow. If

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: I do not wonder how thou dar’st venture to be

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: drunk, not being a tall fellow, trust me not. Hark,

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: the Kings and Princes, our kindred, are going to see

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: the Queen’s picture. Come, follow us. We’ll be thy

speaker:
SHEPHERD’S
               
              SON
text: good masters.
